result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaquile O Slater was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shaquile O Slater is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shaquile O Slater was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Shaquile O Slater was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable Court costs and surcharges.  To be paid during probation period.
If revoked, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during Extended supervision. Any unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never psosess a firearm or body armor; also advised his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No weapons,  new offenses or contact with victim Marvin M.

Complete anger management programming.
Comply with any additional conditions deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA assessment. Follow through with recommended programming.

records.addlTxt:
Clarification of December 16, 2015 Jury Trial Verdict is as follows:

COUNT 5 on case 15CF310 GUILTY
COUNT 6 on case 15CF310 GUILTY

Judgement of Conviction on COUNT 5 and COUNT 6

Defendant Shaquile O Slater in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Shaquile O Slater in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Statements made as to sentencing.  
 
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 2, with credit for 97 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.
Court orders the following conditions of PROBATION and EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming; 
*No weapons;
*No new offenses;
*No contact with victim, Marvin M;
*Complete anger management programming;
*Comply with any additional conditions deemed appropriate by agent. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
Court orders all costs and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation.  If revoked, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Any unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
**Court approves credit subject to defense counsel filing a credit form with the Clerk of Courts.**

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Shaquile O Slater not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct hearing today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D282
cf
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, signed and filed.

Defendant Shaquile O Slater in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Shaquile O Slater in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Jury submitted questions.  Court addresses questions on the record and a response sent back to jury.    At the hour of 4:00 p.m the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY on COUNT 1; NOT GUILTY on COUNT 2; GUILTY on COUNT 3 - with the additional answer to question put forth in COUNT 3 and NO; NOT GUILTY on COUNT 4; GUILTY on COUNT 5 (15CF310); GUILTY on COUNT 6 (15CF310) which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict on COUNT 3, COUNT 5 and COUNT 6; Judgement of Acquittal on COUNT 1, COUNT 2 and COUNT 4.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction on COUNT 3 but penalty enhancer is DISMISSED, COUNT 5 and COUNT 6.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shaquile O Slater in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Shaquile O Slater in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.  Court makes record re: juror #22.  Trial to proceed.  Jury in the box at 9:50am.  Sworn for defense: Sheila K.  Jury out of box.  On motion of the State and for reasons as stated on the record, Court orders COUNT 3 dismissed.  Jury in box.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: MPD Officer Joseph Sanchez.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 12:05pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Walls and Dukat who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour.

Defendant Shaquile O Slater in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Shaquile O Slater in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in the box at 9:06am.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly sworn.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeds.  Sworn for the state: Marvin M., MPD Officer Cassandra Benitez, MPD Sergeant Timothy Gauerke, MPD Officer Joseph Sanchez, MPD Officer Dominique Heaggan-Brown.  Exhibits 1-16 received.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour.  Trial to resume at 2:00pm. 

Trial continues.  Sworn for the State: MPD Robert Welch, MPD Officer Vincent Woller, VA Police Officer Adam Dettman, MPD Officer Troy Mason, VA Police Officer Adam Dettman, MPD Detective Troy Mason, MPD Detective Edward McCrary, MPD Officer Dionte King, Analyst Jeff Zwickey.  Exhibits 17-22 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury released at 4:15pm. Trial to resume on 12/16/15 at 9:00am in Br. 35.

Same appearances.  Jury panel in Court.  Replacement (Juror #22) sworn.  Voir dire proceeds  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury is released for the evening at 4:58 pm.  Court stands in recess, matter to resume on 12/15/15 at 9:00am in Br. 35.

Defendant Shaquile O Slater in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Shaquile O Slater in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial with #14CF1534.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Court places status of the case on the record.  Court passes case. 

Case continues on the record.  Matter will proceed to trial today.  Court orders witnesses sequestered.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeds at the hour of 11:43pm.  Court releases panel, Court stands in recess for the lunch hour.
Filed, jury list

Defendant Shaquile O Slater in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Shaquile O Slater in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers, matter is called on the record with defendant present.  State places offer on the record.  Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 12/16/15 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Defendant Shaquile O Slater in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Shaquile O Slater in custody.  Hanna Kolberg appears for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Court hears argument re: defense request to lower bail. Court DENIES request to amend bail.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
